page.title: 10Agriculture Around Garton
page.content: Farming is highly intensive and profitable.Chalky soils and a low rainfall make conditions very suitable for arable farming.Winter wheat is the main crop .Barley,potatoes,peas,rape, and sugar beet are also grown.Because of excellent farming methods much of the grain is sold to seed merchants in Bridlington.Other seeds are sold to merchants for animal feeds The high cereal acreage results in successful pig farming.Most farmers keep some sheep and are involved in beef production.Farms are highly mechanised and very dependant upon chemicals.There are even fewer employees than 10 years ago. Recent trends include machines that remove stones and the tramlining of crops.There is more emphasis on cash crops.There are an increasing number of winter crops and less spring crops.
